headline.main: Doctors Say Republican Candidates Are in Good Health

docs.abstract: Gov George W Bush says he is in top physical shape and has never had serious illness; his doctor, Kenneth H Cooper, who has performed Bush's annual checkups since 1989, says Bush has 'no significant medical problems' and that all tests for him were normal on June 30, his last checkup; Bush's running mate, Dick Cheney, has had three heart attacks, but none since quadruple bypass operation in 1988; last summer, two doctors issued letters saying Cheney is in 'excellent health' and briefly summarizing his medical history; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. George W. Bush is in top physical shape, has never had a serious illness, and there is no medical reason that he could not serve a full term as president, Mr. Bush and the doctor who has performed Mr. Bush's annual checkups since 1989 said in interviews. Mr. Bush, 54, said yesterday that he was ''perfectly healthy.''
